website_summaries.verdict: The Vivobarefoot Primus Trail SG garnered mostly positive reviews from its users, with comments that focused on the shoe’s performance and its numerous features that proved to be effective. There were only a handful of criticisms that stemmed from fit and sizing issues.
pros: The shoe had an efficient water drainage system, a reviewer stated
A couple of users praised the grippy outsole of the Primus Trail SG
Some wearers pointed out that the toggle lace feature enabled a convenient use
The shoe excelled on wet terrain, including grass and soil, a runner mentioned
A lot of consumers appreciated the lightness of the shoe’s weight
There was enough room for a comfortable toe splay, a customer remarked
Many buyers thought this running shoe was worth its price
The outsole seemed to be durable despite its thinness, a runner cited
cons: The collar was too high and was continually hitting the ankle bone, a user commented
Several runners disliked how the Vivobarefoot Primus Trail SG was too broad to give a relaxed feel
A wearer said the shoe was not comfortable when worn without a sock

customer_reviews.title: Be cautious of sizing.
customer_reviews.text: These are very good barefoot style shoes but I knocked off a star because they are a bit over expensive at £120. I also listened to the reviews that said to get a size up; mistake. Although I am English I have European type slender feet while most English people have wide feet, hence lots of people, I suspect, say to size up. However I find with a size up I trip on my toes when running. Also barefoot shoes need to fit more like a sock less like a shoe for them to work properly. Great shoe and very well made. Just bear in mind the above. I suggest you start with the size you are.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returned this as it won't suit a foot with a high bridge
customer_reviews.text: This show does not have a tongue, as you might have expected - it is much more like a plimsoll in that it is elasticated, albeit with laces to adjust the fit. My issue was that the elastic area over the top of the foot was simply too tight across the top of my right foot and the elastic is a string, not an area, so it dug into my foot quite painfully. I had to do a return on the shoes and am awaiting my refund. Pity though - the soles are nice and it's a good-looking pump.
customer_reviews.author: mistersaxon

customer_reviews.title: Love them, very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: These would get 5 stars as they are great except on wet paving as they are a little slippy - they aren't designed for city walking in the rain and because of the off road grips and tread you will get this - I've experienced the same with others pairs of merrells and not the fault of the manufacturers. I bought these over the others they sold because of the style and would jump at another pair the same but with slicker soles.
customer_reviews.author: Simon C Page

customer_reviews.title: Liberate your feet!
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly comfortable from the start. I liked the seller’s sizing comparison table. Shoes fit very well. Feels like there is more than adequate underfoot support. Just don’t expect the ankle/upper foot support of more rigid shoes. Liked them so much, immediately ordered second pair direct from VivoBarefoot.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Designed for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: Very nice design & quality, Wide mid foot perfect for wide feet comes with a light weight sole and change able laces,if you have large ankles the tongue is sown in.
customer_reviews.author: Gwyn

customer_reviews.title: Really comfortable and well-made.
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased before, so was confident to buy another pair, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Carole Cartwright carolej

customer_reviews.title: watch it!
customer_reviews.text: I hope I'll be able to stretch it so that my foot doesn't hurt, once I have managed to fit the shoe. How can somebody draw a shoe like this? It's good for feet unattached to legs, with no foot neck!
customer_reviews.author: Nicola Grendi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The shoes arrived earlier than expected and are exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.author: Albert Steptoe

customer_reviews.title: Ugly as a clown shoes
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt the ugliest shoes that I’ve ever had. It looks like a clown shoes. Ugly and really uncontrollable, kind of a dry step walking. Never more.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph James Martin

customer_reviews.title: Takes getting used to.
customer_reviews.text: Takes a few weeks to get used to but once you’ve settled into them they’re great, very light, comfortable and stylish.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: A Game Changer in footwear
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly straight from the box. My 2nd pair of vivobarefoot shoes. Again not disappointed! They are a game changer. I’m definitely a better postured more economic runner. Feet are stronger and feel Less tired after being on my feet all day. Gradually moving onto tougher terrain and coping well. Build quality of shoes is excellent with no signs of wear on these after 2 weeks of daily wear or my other pair after 6 months! Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: justin Hill

customer_reviews.title: Normally good, these not so much
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my inov-8 for trail running and I’ve really suffered from blisters. Normally a big fan, so I’d recommend the other lines of shoes, just not this model
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: VIVOBAREFOOT Primus Trail Soft Ground Running Shoes - SS17
feature_bullets: Breathable 3M mesh upper with laminated PU overlays
Soft and breathable textile lining for abrasion-free wear
Removable, flexible, performance 3 mm insole for soft cushioning
Patented, ultra-thin, puncture resistant Soft Ground rubber sole
